Grasping Vines.card_text: Play: Return up to 3 artifacts to their owners’ hands.

Yxilo Bolter.card_text: Fight/Reap: Deal 2<D> to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, purge it.

Customs Office.card_text: Your opponent must pay you 1<A> in order to play an artifact.

Tocsin.card_text: Reap: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

Titan Mechanic.card_text: While Titan Mechanic is on a flank, each key costs –1<A>.
Titan Mechanic.flavor_text: If they come, they will build it.

Foggify.card_text: Play: Your opponent cannot use creatures to fight on their next turn.

Troop Call.card_text: Play: Return each friendly Niffle creature from your discard pile and from play to your hand.

Blood Money.card_text: Play: Place 2<A> from the common supply on an enemy creature.

Dance of Doom.card_text: Play: Choose a number. Destroy each creature with power equal to that number.

Lifeward.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Lifeward. Your opponent cannot play creatures on their next turn.

Vigor.card_text: Play: Heal up to 3 damage from a creature. If you healed 3 damage, gain 1<A>.

Round Table.card_text: Each friendly Knight creature gets +1 power and gains taunt.
Round Table.flavor_text: “Come my friends, let us ready for battle.” –King Godfrey Greywind

Novu Archaeologist.card_text: Action: Archive a card from your discard pile.
Novu Archaeologist.flavor_text: “One civilization’s trash is... nope, still trash.”

Shoulder Armor.card_text: While this creature is on a flank, it gets +2 armor and +2 power.
Shoulder Armor.flavor_text: “I can’t see anything. Do I look cool?”

Protect the Weak.card_text: This creature gets +1 armor and gains taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)

Ritual of the Hunt.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Ritual of the Hunt. For the remainder of the turn, you may use friendly Untamed creatures.

Hysteria.card_text: Play: Return each creature to its owner’s hand.

Inspiration.card_text: Play: Ready and use a friendly creature.
Inspiration.flavor_text: “The Sanctum gives meaning to my life.” - Duma the Martyr

Lost in the Woods.card_text: Play: Choose 2 friendly creatures and 2 enemy creatures. Shuffle each chosen creature into its owner’s deck.

Dew Faerie.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: Gain 1<A>.

Effervescent Principle.card_text: Play: Each player loses half their <A> (rounding down the loss). Gain 1 chain.

Soft Landing.card_text: Play: The next creature or artifact you play this turn enters play ready.
Soft Landing.flavor_text: Any landing you walk away from…

Scout.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, up to 2 friendly creatures gain skirmish. Then, fight with those creatures one at a time.

Hand of Dis.card_text: Play: Destroy a creature that is not on a flank.

Soul Snatcher.card_text: Each time a creature is destroyed, its owner gains 1<A>.
Soul Snatcher.flavor_text: No one goes in, no one comes out. And yet the fires burn.

Horseman of Pestilence.card_text: Play/Fight/Reap: Deal 1<D> to each non-Horseman creature.

Mushroom Man.card_text: Mushroom Man gets +3 power for each unforged key you have.
Mushroom Man.flavor_text: “He’s a real fun guy if you get to know him.” –Eldest Bear

Mother.card_text: During your “draw cards” step, refill your hand to 1 additional card.
Mother.flavor_text: “Of course she’s necessary, she’s the mother of all invention!”

Library of Babble.flavor_text: When you make an archive of all knowledge in the galaxy, don’t be surprised when you understand almost none of it.

Curiosity.flavor_text: “It started with Schrödinger’s cat and just kept going from there.” – Quixo the “Adventurer”

Witch of the Eye.card_text: Reap: Return a card from your discard pile to your hand.

Psychic Network.card_text: Play: Steal 1<A> for each friendly ready Mars creature.

Mating Season.card_text: Play: Shuffle each Mars creature into its owner’s deck. Each player gains 1<A> for each creature shuffled into their deck this way.

Random Access Archives.card_text: Play: Archive the top card of your deck.

Pitlord.card_text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)While Pitlord is in play you must choose Dis as your active house.

Mothergun.card_text: Action: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. Deal damage to a creature equal to the number of Mars cards revealed this way.

Nepenthe Seed.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Nepenthe Seed. Return a card from your discard pile to your hand.

Lupo the Scarred.card_text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.) Play: Deal 2<D> to an enemy creature.
Lupo the Scarred.flavor_text: “Nothing that big should be able to move that silently.”  –Lost Lukas Lawrence

Nocturnal Maneuver.flavor_text: Every world has its fearsome creatures that thrive in the darkness, and the Crucible has them all.

Sequis.flavor_text: “I follow the Æmber light of the Sanctum, the light of truth and hope. What is it you follow?”

Champion Anaphiel.card_text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)
Champion Anaphiel.flavor_text: “Steel thyself, Knave. To harm them you must first defeat me.”

Way of the Bear.card_text: This creature gains assault 2. (Before this creature attacks, deal 2<D> to the attacked enemy.)

Mothership Support.card_text: Play: For each friendly ready Mars creature, deal 2<D> to a creature. (You may choose a different creature each time.)

Chota Hazri.card_text: Play: Lose 1<A>. If you do, you may forge a key at current cost.
Chota Hazri.flavor_text: “Plenty of machines in the wild. Some of ‘em’s even alive.”

Magda the Rat.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Play: Steal 2<A>.Leaves Play: Your opponent steals 2<A>.

Relentless Assault.card_text: Play: Ready and fight with up to 3 different friendly creatures, one at a time.

Cleansing Wave.card_text: Play: Heal 1 damage from each creature. Gain 1<A> for each creature healed this way.

Save the Pack.card_text: Play: Destroy each damaged creature. Gain 1 chain.

Mighty Javelin.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Mighty Javelin. Deal 4<D> to a creature.

Ganymede Archivist.flavor_text: “They offered to let my crew stay with them. I politely declined.” –Captain Val Jericho

Anger.card_text: Play: Ready and fight with a friendly creature.
Anger.flavor_text: “Don’t make them angry you say? Heh. The Brobnar are born angry.” –Old Bruno

Kindrith Longshot.card_text: Elusive. Skirmish.Reap: Deal 2<D> to a creature.

Tendrils of Pain.card_text: Play: Deal 1<D> to each creature. Deal an additional 3<D> to each creature if your opponent forged a key on their previous turn.

Glorious Few.card_text: Play: For each creature your opponent controls in excess of you, gain 1<A>.

Phase Shift.card_text: Play: You may play one non-Logos card this turn.

Longfused Mines.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Longfused Mines. Deal 3<D> to each enemy creature not on a flank.

Library Access.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each time you play another card, draw a card.

Labwork.flavor_text: Attention to detail is the key to all progress.

Jammer Pack.card_text: This creature gains, “Your opponent's keys cost +2<A>.“

Autocannon.card_text: Deal 1<D> to each creature after it enters play.

Remote Access.card_text: Play: Use an opponent's artifact as if it were yours.

Krump.card_text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Krump, its controller loses 1<A>.

Nerve Blast.card_text: Play: Steal 1<A>. If you do, deal 2<D> to a creature.
Nerve Blast.flavor_text: “Don’t look so shocked to see me!”

Gongoozle.card_text: Play: Deal 3<D> to a creature. If it is not destroyed, its owner discards a random card from their hand.
Gongoozle.flavor_text: “Just trying to understand these...’things’ gives me a headache.”

Too Much to Protect.card_text: Play: Steal all but 6 of your opponent’s <A>.
Too Much to Protect.flavor_text: Not taking it would be the real crime.

Poltergeist.card_text: Play: Use an artifact controlled by any player as if it were yours. Destroy that artifact.

Horseman of Famine.card_text: Play/Fight/Reap: Destroy the least powerful creature.

Grommid.card_text: You cannot play creatures.  After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Grommid, your opponent loses 1<A>.

Lifeweb.card_text: Play: If your opponent played 3 or more creatures on their previous turn, steal 2<A>.

Ember Imp.card_text: Your opponent cannot play more than 2 cards each turn.

Commander Remiel.card_text: Reap: Use a friendly non-Sanctum creature.
Commander Remiel.flavor_text: “I was not always a knight. Perhaps, someday, you will stand where I stand and see what I see.”

Research Smoko.card_text: Destroyed: Archive the top card of your deck.

Pawn Sacrifice.card_text: Play: Sacrifice a friendly creature. If you do, deal 3<D> each to 2 creatures.

Old Bruno.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Play: Capture 3<A>.

Barehanded.card_text: Play: Put each artifact on top of its owner’s deck.

Mighty Lance.card_text: Play: Deal 3<D> to a creature and 3<D> to a neighbor of that creature.

Control the Weak.card_text: Play: Choose a house on your opponent’s identity card. Your opponent must choose that house as their active house on their next turn.

Sloppy Labwork.card_text: Play: Archive a card. Discard a card.
Sloppy Labwork.flavor_text: Don’t fret the details. Progress happens when you least expect it.

Epic Quest.card_text: Play: Archive each friendly Knight creature in play.Omni: If you have played 7 or more Sanctum cards this turn, sacrifice Epic Quest and forge a key at no cost.

Lava Ball.card_text: Play: Deal 4<D> to a creature with 2<D> splash.

Gatekeeper.card_text: Play: If your opponent has 7 or more <A>, capture all but 5 of it.

Shatter Storm.card_text: Play: Lose all your <A>. Then, your opponent loses triple the amount of <A> you lost this way.

Key Charge.card_text: Play: Lose 1<A>. If you do, you may forge a key at current cost.
Key Charge.flavor_text: “You might call it madness, but for all we know madness is a key ingredient.” –Inka the Spider

Chaos Portal.card_text: Action: Choose a house. Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is of that house, play it.

Mind Barb.card_text: Play: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

Zorg.card_text: Zorg enters play stunned. Before Fight: Stun the creature Zorg fights and each of that creature’s neighbors.

Hallowed Blaster.card_text: Action: Heal 3 damage from a creature.
Hallowed Blaster.flavor_text: Swords into plowshares is thinking too small.

Blypyp.card_text: Reap: The next Mars creature you play this turn enters play ready.

Screaming Cave.card_text: Action: Shuffle your hand and discard pile into your deck.
Screaming Cave.flavor_text: ”Was that you, or the cave?” - Captain<nonbreak>Val<nonbreak>Jericho

Flaxia.card_text: Play: Gain 2<A> if you control more creatures than your opponent.

The Sting.card_text: Skip your “forge a key” step.You get all <A> spent by your opponent when forging keys.Action: Sacrifice The Sting.

Dust Pixie.flavor_text: The faeries are believed to be created by the Architects to tend to the plants and animals of the Crucible. In the eons since their creation, some have become…quirky.

Vespilon Theorist.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: Choose a house. Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is of that house, archive it and gain 1<A>. Otherwise, discard it.

Combat Pheromones.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Combat Pheromones. You may use up to 2 other Mars cards this turn.
Combat Pheromones.flavor_text: “Don’t worry, this will only sting a lot.”

A Fair Game.card_text: Play: Discard the top card of your opponent’s deck and reveal their hand. You gain 1<A> for each card of the discarded card’s house revealed this way. Your opponent repeats the preceding effect on you.

“John Smyth”.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Fight/Reap: Ready a non-Agent Mars creature.

Gabos Longarms.card_text: Before Fight: Choose a creature. Gabos Longarms deals damage to that creature rather than the one it is fighting.

Tunk.card_text: After you play another Mars creature, fully heal Tunk.
Tunk.flavor_text: “Who’s driving?” “I thought you were.”“Let’s…not tell the Elders.”

Troll.flavor_text: Don’t feed it, it’ll go away.

Valdr.card_text: Valdr deals +2<D> while attacking an enemy creature on the flank.

Squawker.card_text: Play: Ready a Mars creature or stun a non-Mars creature.

The Terror.card_text: Play: If your opponent has no <A>, gain 2<A>.
The Terror.flavor_text: “I once thought that these creatures could be redeemed. Now I know better.” –Champion Anaphiel

Yxili Marauder.card_text: Yxili Marauder gets +1 power for each <A> on it.Play: Capture 1<A> for each friendly ready Mars creature.

Smith.card_text: Play: Gain 2<A> if you control more creatures than your opponent.

Pile of Skulls.card_text: Each time an enemy creature is destroyed during your turn, a friendly creature captures 1<A>.

King of the Crag.card_text: Each enemy Brobnar creature gets –2 power.
King of the Crag.flavor_text: Overthrowing this king is an uphill battle.

Snufflegator.card_text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)

Treasure Map.card_text: Play: If you have not played any other cards this turn, gain 3<A>. For the remainder of the turn, you cannot play cards.

Niffle Queen.card_text: Each other friendly Beast creature gets +1 power.Each other friendly Niffle creature gets +1 power.

Sergeant Zakiel.card_text: Play: You may ready and fight with a neighboring creature.

Gorm of Omm.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Gorm of Omm. Destroy an artifact.
Gorm of Omm.flavor_text: “An object, no matter how sacred, is just a thing.”

Umbra.card_text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Fight: Steal 1<A>.
Umbra.flavor_text: “When the fightin’s done, the real work begins.”

Halacor.card_text: Each friendly flank creature gains skirmish. (When you use a creature with skirmish to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)
Halacor.flavor_text: “Forget the others, have you seen the teeth on that one?!”

Take Hostages.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each time a friendly creature fights, it captures 1<A>.

Dextre.card_text: Play: Capture 1<A>.Destroyed: Put Dextre on top of your deck.

Warsong.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1<A> each time a friendly creature fights.

Invasion Portal.card_text: Action: Discard cards from the top of your deck until you discard a Mars creature or run out of cards. If you discard a Mars creature this way, put it into your hand.

One Last Job.card_text: Play: Purge each friendly Shadows creature. Steal 1<A> for each creature purged this way.

Gateway to Dis.card_text: Play: Destroy each creature. Gain 3 chains.

Guardian Demon.card_text: Play/Fight/Reap: Heal up to 2 damage from a creature. Deal that amount of damage to another creature.

Tentacus.card_text: Your opponent must pay you 1<A> in order to use an artifact.

Burn the Stockpile.card_text: Play: If your opponent has 7<A> or more, they lose 4<A>.
Burn the Stockpile.flavor_text: “If you can’t protect it, you don’t deserve it.” –Bilgum Avalanche

Rocket Boots.card_text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: If this is the first time this creature was used this turn, ready it.”

Terms of Redress.card_text: Play: Choose a friendly creature to capture 2<A>.

Veylan Analyst.card_text: Each time you use an artifact, gain 1<A>.
Veylan Analyst.flavor_text: Logos are divided into two camps: Theorists and Mechanists. Each believes themselves to be superior to the other.

Speed Sigil.card_text: The first creature played each turn enters play ready.

Succubus.card_text: During their “draw cards” step, your opponent refills their hand to 1 less card.

Earthshaker.card_text: Play: Destroy each creature with power 3 or lower.

The Spirit’s Way.card_text: Play: Destroy each creature with power 3 or higher.
The Spirit’s Way.flavor_text: “The spirit is eternal. The flesh is weak. Let go the flesh, for your earthly strength is the greatest prison.” - The Last Book

Neuro Syphon.card_text: Play: If your opponent has more <A> than you, steal 1<A> and draw a card.

Rock-Hurling Giant.card_text: During your turn, each time you discard a Brobnar card from your hand, you may deal 4<D> to a creature.

Ring of Invisibility.card_text: This creature gains elusive and skirmish.
Ring of Invisibility.flavor_text: “I put it down for just a second...”

Booby Trap.card_text: Play: Deal 4<D> to a creature that is not on a flank with 2<D> splash.

Bulleteye.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: Destroy a flank creature.

Briar Grubbling.card_text: Hazardous 5. (Before this creature is attacked, deal 5<D> to the attacking enemy.)
Briar Grubbling.flavor_text: Nature says “do not touch” in so many creative ways.

Twin Bolt Emission.card_text: Play: Deal 2<D> to a creature and deal 2<D> to a different creature.

Mack the Knife.card_text: Elusive.You may use Mack the Knife as if it belonged to the active house.Action: Deal 1<D> to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, gain 1<A>.

Nature’s Call.card_text: Play: Return up to 3 creatures to their owners’ hands.

Bigtwig.card_text: Bigtwig can only fight stunned creatures. Reap: Stun and exhaust a creature.

Mighty Tiger.card_text: Play: Deal 4<D> to an enemy creature.

Fear.card_text: Play: Return an enemy creature to its owner’s hand.

Library of the Damned.flavor_text: ”This place takes the idea of losing yourself in a book to a whole new level.” – Doc Bookton

Shaffles.card_text: At the end of your turn, your opponent loses 1<A>.
Shaffles.flavor_text: “Do you want imps? This is how you get imps.”

Pit Demon.flavor_text: “They come from another world, they are pure evil made flesh and steel, and they lurk in the darkest corners of the land. Yes, I’m comfortable calling them ‘demons.’” –Science Officer Wu

Phylyx the Disintegrator.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Action: Your opponent loses 1<A> for each other friendly Mars creature.

Sample Collection.card_text: Play: Put an enemy creature into your archives for each key your opponent has forged. If any of these creatures leave your archives, they are put into their owner’s hand instead.

Giant Sloth.card_text: You cannot use this card unless you have discarded an Untamed card from your hand this turn.Action: Gain 3<A>.

Key Hammer.card_text: Play: If your opponent forged a key on their previous turn, unforge it. Your opponent gains 6<A>.

Wild Wormhole.card_text: Play: Play the top card of your deck.
Wild Wormhole.flavor_text: “But if we ever do recover the dataprobe, think of what we will learn!”

Champion Tabris.flavor_text: “All my skill in battle brings me not one step closer to Enlightenment.”

Horseman of War.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature can be used as if they were in the active house, but can only fight.
Horseman of War.flavor_text: And one only comes to slay.

Drumble.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Play: If your opponent has 7<A> or more, capture all of it.

Battle Fleet.card_text: Play: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. For each card revealed this way, draw 1 card.

Virtuous Works.flavor_text: On the Crucible, there is no sanctimony. There is only Sanctumony.

Irradiated Æmber.card_text: Play: If your opponent has 6<A> or more, deal 3<D> to each enemy creature.
Irradiated Æmber.flavor_text: “They poisoned Mars. We must not let them do the same here.” –Eldest Bear

Potion of Invulnerability.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Potion of Invulnerability. For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature cannot be dealt damage.

Sneklifter.card_text: Play: Take control of an enemy artifact. While under your control, if it does not belong to one of your three houses, it is considered to be of house Shadows.

Snudge.card_text: Fight/Reap: Return an artifact or flank creature to its owner’s hand.
Snudge.flavor_text: It’s only sensible to fear the dark.

Scrambler Storm.card_text: Play: Your opponent cannot play action cards on their next turn.

Special Delivery.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Special Delivery. Deal 3<D> to a flank creature. If this damage destroys that creature, purge it.

Sigil of Brotherhood.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Sigil of Brotherhood. For the remainder of the turn, you may use friendly Sanctum creatures.

Bulwark.card_text: Each of Bulwark’s neighbors gets +2 armor.

Spectral Tunneler.card_text: Action: Choose a creature. For the remainder of the turn, that creature is considered a flank creature and gains, “Reap: Draw a card.”

Relentless Whispers.card_text: Play: Deal 2<D> to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, steal 1<A>.

Loot the Bodies.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1<A> each time an enemy creature is destroyed.
Loot the Bodies.flavor_text: “Loot the Bodies! Hit the Floor! Loot the Bodies! Hit the Floor!” –Brobnar War Chant

Eater of the Dead.card_text: Fight/Reap: Purge a creature from a discard pile. If you do, put a +1 power counter on Eater of the Dead.

Deep Probe.card_text: Play: Choose a house. Reveal your opponent's hand. Discard each creature of that house revealed this way.

Doc Bookton.flavor_text: “Don’t worry, Momo. We’ll have this quantum death ray installed in no time.”

EMP Blast.card_text: Play: Each Mars creature and each Robot creature is stunned. Each artifact is destroyed.

Truebaru.card_text: You must lose 3<A> in order to play Truebaru.  Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Destroyed: Gain 5<A>.

Subtle Maul.card_text: Action: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

Grey Monk.card_text: Each friendly creature gets +1 armor. Reap: Heal 2 damage from a creature.

Oubliette.card_text: Play: Purge a creature with power 3 or lower.
Oubliette.flavor_text: “I forgot we had this down here!”

Seeker Needle.card_text: Action: Deal 1<D> to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, gain 1<A>.

Armageddon Cloak.card_text: This creature gains hazardous 2 and, “Destroyed: Fully heal this creature and destroy Armageddon Cloak instead.”

Key of Darkness.card_text: Play: Forge a key at +6<A> current cost. If your opponent has no <A>, forge a key at +2<A> current cost instead.

Batdrone.card_text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Fight: Steal 1<A>.
Batdrone.flavor_text: The worst part is the singing.

Murmook.flavor_text: “Look out for the pincers and don’t make it crabby. “ –Dr. Escotera

Staunch Knight.card_text: Staunch Knight gets +2 power while it is on a flank.

Horseman of Death.card_text: Play: Return each Horseman creature from your discard pile to your hand.

Key Abduction.card_text: Play: Return each Mars creature to its owner's hand. Then, you may forge a key at +9<A> current cost, reduced by 1<A> for each card in your hand.

Mindwarper.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Action: Choose an enemy creature. It captures 1<A> from its own side.

Full Moon.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1<A> each time you play a creature.
Full Moon.flavor_text: ”Mathematically, a moon orbiting the Crucible is impossible.””Then what is that?!”

Lomir Flamefist.card_text: Play: If your opponent has 7<A> or more, they lose 2<A>.
Lomir Flamefist.flavor_text: “I thought his name would turn out to be... metaphorical.” – Quixo the “Adventurer”

Mimicry.card_text: When you play this card, treat it as a copy of an action card in your opponent’s discard pile.
Mimicry.flavor_text: It is said that if you travel far enough across the Crucible, you will eventually meet yourself.

Ritual of Balance.card_text: Action: If your opponent has 6<A> or more, steal 1<A>.
Ritual of Balance.flavor_text: Is balance a means to an end, or an end in itself?

Timetraveller.card_text: Play: Draw 2 cards. Action: Shuffle Timetraveller into your deck.

Biomatrix Backup.card_text: This creature gains, “Destroyed: You may put this creature into its owner's archives.”

Blinding Light.card_text: Play: Choose a house. Stun each creature of that house.

Bad Penny.card_text: Destroyed: Return Bad Penny to your hand.
Bad Penny.flavor_text: A Bad Penny saved is a Bad Penny earned.

World Tree.card_text: Action: Return a creature from your discard pile to the top of your deck.

Dysania.card_text: Play: Your opponent discards each of their archived cards. You gain 1<A> for each card discarded this way.

Silvertooth.flavor_text: If you see teeth gleaming in the dark, it’s already too late.

Grabber Jammer.card_text: Your opponent’s keys cost +1<A>.Fight/Reap: Capture 1<A>.

Pandemonium.card_text: Play: Each undamaged creature captures 1<A> from its opponent.

Yxilx Dominator.card_text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Yxilx Dominator enters play stunned.
Yxilx Dominator.flavor_text: Core power online. Stand by for domination.

Radiant Truth.card_text: Play: Stun each enemy creature not on a flank.
Radiant Truth.flavor_text: “Truly I say to you: pie is superior to cake.” - from the Ravings of the Prophet Gizelhart

Lights Out.card_text: Play: Return 2 enemy creatures to their owner’s hand.

Quixo the “Adventurer”.card_text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Fight: Draw a card.
Quixo the “Adventurer”.flavor_text: “...I’ll leave this part out of the memoir.”

Shooler.card_text: Play: If your opponent has 4<A> or more, steal 1<A>.
Shooler.flavor_text: “Demons only take, never give.” - The Sanctified Scroll

Blood of Titans.flavor_text: “Blood of Giants? Why stop there?”  –Pingle Who Annoys

Duskrunner.flavor_text: “Call me Night-Haunter and Duskrunner, call me Who-Goes-There? and Just-The-Wind.” –‘The First Thief’, a Shadows children’s tale

Whispering Reliquary.card_text: Action: Return an artifact to its owner's hand.

Cooperative Hunting.card_text: Play: Deal 1<D> for each friendly creature in play. You may divide this damage among any number of creatures.

Smaaash.flavor_text: “I’m not sure he knows any other words.”

Flame-Wreathed.card_text: This creature gets +2 power and gains hazardous 2. (Before this creature is attacked, deal 2<D> to the attacking enemy.)

Sound the Horns.card_text: Play: Discard cards from the top of your deck until you either discard a Brobnar creature or run out of cards. If you discarded a Brobnar creature this way, put it into your hand.

Smiling Ruth.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: If you forged a key this turn, take control of an enemy flank creature.

Key to Dis.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Key to Dis. Destroy each creature.

Noddy the Thief.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Action: Steal 1<A>.

Faygin.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: Return an Urchin from play or from your discard pile to your hand.

Regrowth.card_text: Play: Return a creature from your discard pile to your hand.
Regrowth.flavor_text: “Deep in the heart of every bear, one can find...another bear.” -Dr. Escotera

Shield of Justice.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature cannot be dealt damage.

Unguarded Camp.card_text: Play: For each creature you have in excess of your opponent, a friendly creature captures 1<A>. Each creature cannot capture more than 1<A> this way.

Hunting Witch.card_text: Each time you play another creature, gain 1<A>.

Safe Place.card_text: You may spend <A> on Safe Place when forging keys.Action: Move 1<A> from your pool to Safe Place.

Gauntlet of Command.card_text: Action: Ready and fight with a friendly creature.
Gauntlet of Command.flavor_text: “I said ‘take me to your leader’ and got a fist to the face.”  –Captain Val Jericho

Macis Asp.card_text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Poison. (Any damage dealt by this creature’s power during a fight destroys the damaged creature.)

Evasion Sigil.card_text: Before a creature fights, discard the top card of its controller's deck. If the discarded card is of the active house, exhaust that creature with no effect.

Dr. Escotera.card_text: Play: Gain 1<A> for each forged key your opponent has.
Dr. Escotera.flavor_text: “Interesting reaction, but what does it mean?”

Wardrummer.card_text: Play: Return each other friendly Brobnar creature to your hand.

Fogbank.card_text: Play: Your opponent cannot use creatures to fight on their next turn.

Experimental Therapy.card_text: This creature belongs to all houses.Play: Stun and exhaust this creature.
Experimental Therapy.flavor_text: “This is for our research, so be honest. How do you feel?”

Three Fates.card_text: Play: Destroy the 3 most powerful creatures.

Charge!.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each creature you play gains, “Play: Deal 2<D> to an enemy creature.”

Lash of Broken Dreams.card_text: Action: Keys cost +3<A> during your opponent’s next turn.
Lash of Broken Dreams.flavor_text: “At first, I thought that nothing could harm an Archon.”  –Captain Val Jericho

Stealer of Souls.card_text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Stealer of Souls, purge that creature and gain 1<A>.

Knowledge is Power.card_text: Play: Choose one: Archive a card, or, for each archived card you have, gain 1<A>.

Shadow Self.card_text: Shadow Self deals no damage when fighting.  Damage dealt to non-Specter neighbors is dealt to Shadow Self instead.

Lord Golgotha.card_text: Before Fight: Deal 3<D> to each neighbor of the creature Lord Golgotha fights.

Niffle Ape.card_text: While Niffle Ape is attacking, ignore taunt and elusive.
Niffle Ape.flavor_text: “Did it just say Niffle?” –Captain Val Jericho

Urchin.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Play: Steal 1<A>.

The Warchest.card_text: Action: Gain 1<A> for each enemy creature that was destroyed in a fight this turn.
The Warchest.flavor_text: It doesn’t matter what the treasure is, only how it was won.

Protectrix.card_text: Reap: You may fully heal a creature. If you do, that creature cannot be dealt damage for the remainder of the turn.

Master of 3.card_text: Reap: You may destroy a creature with 3 power.

Headhunter.flavor_text: “I mean, I think it’s a head...”

Positron Bolt.card_text: Play: Deal 3<D> to a flank creature. Deal 2<D> to its neighbor. Deal 1<D> to the second creature’s other neighbor.

Ammonia Clouds.flavor_text: Partly cloudy with a chance of acid rain.

Doorstep to Heaven.card_text: Play: Each player with 6<A> or more is reduced to 5<A>.
Doorstep to Heaven.flavor_text: The cities of the Sanctum are safe, clean, and vibrant like few others on the Crucible. But few are judged worthy to enter.

Inka the Spider.card_text: Poison. (Any damage dealt by this creature’s power during a fight destroys the damaged creature.)Play/Reap: Stun a creature.

Ulyq Megamouth.card_text: Fight/Reap: Use a friendly non-Mars creature.

Zyzzix the Many.card_text: Fight/Reap: You may reveal a creature from your hand. If you do, archive it and Zyzzix the Many gets three +1 power counters.

Interdimensional Graft.card_text: Play: If an opponent forges a key on their next turn, they must give you their remaining <A>.

Firespitter.card_text: Before Fight: Deal 1<D> to each enemy creature.
Firespitter.flavor_text: Guess how he got that name.

Raiding Knight.flavor_text: “Sacred Æmber is not meant for hands such as thine.”

Selwyn the Fence.card_text: Fight/Reap: Move 1<A> from one of your cards to your pool.

Miasma.card_text: Play: Your opponent skips the “forge a key” step on their next turn.

Ancient Bear.card_text: Assault 2.(Before this creature attacks, deal 2<D> to the attacked enemy.)
Ancient Bear.flavor_text: ”And when I say ‘bear,’ I mean it in the loosest of terms.” – Quixo the “Adventurer”

Nexus.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: Use an opponent’s artifact as if it were yours.

Vezyma Thinkdrone.card_text: Reap: You may archive a friendly creature or artifact from play.
Vezyma Thinkdrone.flavor_text: Nothing helps me think like wanton destruction.

Dust Imp.flavor_text: When the demon’s away, the imps will play.

Ghostly Hand.card_text: Play: If your opponent has exactly 1<A>, steal it.
Ghostly Hand.flavor_text: “I felt a little bad stealing from the Microputians, but only a little.” – Noddy the Thief

Masterplan.card_text: Play: Put a card from your hand facedown beneath Masterplan.Omni: Play the card beneath Masterplan. Sacrifice Masterplan.

Arise!.card_text: Play: Choose a house. Return each creature of that house from your discard pile to your hand. Gain 1 chain.

Qyxxlyx Plague Master.card_text: Fight/Reap: Deal 3<D> to each Human creature. This damage cannot be prevented by armor.

Bait and Switch.card_text: Play: If your opponent has more <A> than you, steal 1<A>. Repeat this card's effect if your opponent still has more <A> than you.

Help from Future Self.card_text: Play: Search your deck and discard pile for a Timetraveller, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your discard pile into your deck.

Carlo Phantom.card_text: Elusive. Skirmish.Each time you play an artifact, steal 1<A>.
Carlo Phantom.flavor_text: “Give me half a chance an’ I’ll steal the whole of it.”

Tremor.card_text: Play: Stun a creature and each of its neighbors.

Dominator Bauble.flavor_text: “I know I shouldn’t’a nicked it, but ‘twere so…shiny. –Noddy the Thief

Mass Abduction.card_text: Play: Put up to 3 damaged enemy creatures into your archives. If any of these creatures leave your archives, they are put into their owner’s hand instead.

Uxlyx the Zookeeper.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: Put an enemy creature into your archives. If that creature leaves your archives, it is put into its owner’s hand instead.

Lady Maxena.card_text: Play: Stun a creature. Action: Return Lady Maxena to its owner’s hand.

Sacrificial Altar.card_text: Action: Purge a friendly Human creature from play. If you do, play a creature from your discard pile.

Mantle of the Zealot.card_text: This creature gains, “You may use this creature as if it belonged to the active house.”

Dimension Door.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, any <A> you would gain from reaping is stolen from your opponent instead.

Spangler Box.card_text: Action: Purge a creature in play. If you do, your opponent gains control of Spangler Box. If Spangler Box leaves play, return to play all cards purged by Spangler Box.

Red-Hot Armor.card_text: Play: Each enemy creature with armor loses all of its armor until the end of the turn and is dealt 1<D> for each point of armor it lost this way.

Ether Spider.card_text: Ether Spider deals no damage when fighting.Each <A> that would be added to your opponent’s pool is captured by Ether Spider instead.

Transposition Sandals.card_text: This creature gains, “Action: Swap this creature with another friendly creature in the battleline. You may use that other creature this turn.”

Screechbomb.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Screechbomb. Your opponent loses 2<A>.
Screechbomb.flavor_text: “I think that thing made me deaf!”“What? I can’t hear you! I think that thing made me deaf!”

Martians Make Bad Allies.card_text: Play: Reveal your hand. Purge each revealed non-Mars creature and gain 1<A> for each card purged this way.

Phoenix Heart.card_text: This creature gains, “Destroyed: Return this creature to its owner’s hand and deal 3<D> to each creature in play.”

Clear Mind.flavor_text: Thy body is an illusion. Only thy spirit is eternal.

Jehu the Bureaucrat.card_text: After you choose Sanctum as your active house, gain 2<A>.
Jehu the Bureaucrat.flavor_text: “The knights protect the Sanctum. They are entitled to certain... benefits.”

Brain Eater.card_text: After a creature is destroyed fighting Brain Eater, draw a card.

Psychic Bug.card_text: Play/Reap: Look at your opponent’s hand.
Psychic Bug.flavor_text: “I’d make more, but I discovered lesser minds aren’t worth reading.” – Biologician Moreau

Total Recall.card_text: Play: For each friendly ready creature, gain 1<A>. Return each friendly creature to your hand.

Brain Stem Antenna.card_text: This creature gains, “After you play a Mars creature, ready this creature and for the remainder of the turn it belongs to house Mars.”

Master of 1.card_text: Reap: You may destroy a creature with 1 power.

Pingle Who Annoys.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Deal 1<D> to each enemy creature after it enters play.

Skippy Timehog.card_text: Play: Your opponent cannot use any cards next turn. (Cards can still be played and discarded.)

Phosphorus Stars.card_text: Play: Stun each non-Mars creature. Gain 2 chains.
Phosphorus Stars.flavor_text: “Martians love da smell of dis spice, but it reminds me of Old Bruno’s feet.” - Dodger

Numquid the Fair.card_text: Play: Destroy an enemy creature. Repeat this card’s effect if your opponent still controls more creatures than you.

Deipno Spymaster.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Omni: Choose a friendly creature. You may use that creature this turn.

Neutron Shark.card_text: Play/Fight/Reap: Destroy an enemy creature or artifact and a friendly creature or artifact. Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is not a Logos card, trigger this effect again.

Crystal Hive.card_text: Action: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1<A> each time a creature reaps.
Crystal Hive.flavor_text: Behold the glory of Nova Hellas!

Hecatomb.card_text: Play: Destroy each Dis creature. Each player gains 1<A> for each creature they controlled that was destroyed this way.

Coward’s End.card_text: Play: Destroy each undamaged creature. Gain 3 chains.

Way of the Wolf.card_text: This creature gains skirmish.  (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)

Commpod.card_text: Action: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. For each card revealed this way, you may ready one Mars creature.

Bilgum Avalanche.card_text: After you forge a key, deal 2<D> to each enemy creature.
Bilgum Avalanche.flavor_text: “Some call her ‘warleader.’ Some call her ‘demon.’ I just call her ‘Avalanche.’” –Dodger

Ganger Chieftain.card_text: Play: You may ready and fight with a neighboring creature.
Ganger Chieftain.flavor_text: It takes two to fight, but more is better.

The Harder They Come.card_text: Play: Purge a creature with power 5 or higher.

Orbital Bombardment.card_text: Play: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. For each card revealed this way, deal 2<D> to a creature. (You may choose a different creature each time.)

Routine Job.card_text: Play: Steal 1<A>. Then, steal 1<A> for each copy of Routine Job in your discard pile.

Follow the Leader.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature may fight.

Silent Dagger.card_text: This creature gains, “Reap: Deal 4<D> to a flank creature.”

Incubation Chamber.card_text: Omni: Reveal a Mars creature from your hand. If you do, archive it.
Incubation Chamber.flavor_text: Most Martians on the Crucible came out of one of these tanks.

Overlord Greking.card_text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Overlord Greking, put that creature into play under your control.

Finishing Blow.card_text: Play: Destroy a damaged creature. If you do, steal 1<A>.

Tolas.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Each time a creature is destroyed, its opponent gains 1<A>.

Bumpsy.flavor_text: Whatever he doesn’t like, he breaks. He doesn’t like anything.

Bouncing Deathquark.card_text: Play: Destroy an enemy creature and a friendly creature. You may repeat this effect as many times as you like, as long as it is possible to repeat the entire effect.

Honorable Claim.card_text: Play: Each friendly Knight creature captures 1<A>.
Honorable Claim.flavor_text: “As your spirit is holy, so æmber, which is the spirit of the earth, is holy.” - The Sanctified Scroll

Crazy Killing Machine.card_text: Action: Discard the top card of each player’s deck. For each of those cards, destroy a creature or artifact of that card’s house, if able. If 2 cards are not destroyed as a result of this, destroy Crazy Killing Machine.

Mobius Scroll.card_text: Action: Archive Mobius Scroll and up to 2 cards from your hand.
Mobius Scroll.flavor_text: Once upon a time there was a scroll that began: Once upon a time…

Pocket Universe.card_text: You may spend <A> on Pocket Universe when forging keys.Action: Move 1<A> from your pool to Pocket Universe.

Francus.card_text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Francus, Francus captures 1<A>.

The Howling Pit.card_text: During their “draw cards” step, each player refills their hand to 1 additional card.

Perilous Wild.flavor_text: The Architects took great pains to make the Crucible inhabitable for creatures from worlds across the galaxy. But they didn’t make it safe.

Tireless Crocag.card_text: Tireless Crocag cannot reap.You may use Tireless Crocag as if it belonged to the active house.If your opponent has no creatures in play, destroy Tireless Crocag.

Red Planet Ray Gun.card_text: This creature gains, “Reap: Choose a creature. Deal 1<D> to that creature for each Mars creature in play.”

Champion’s Challenge.card_text: Play: Destroy each enemy creature except the most powerful enemy creature. Destroy each friendly creature except the most powerful friendly creature. Ready and fight with your remaining creature.

Strange Gizmo.card_text: After you forge a key, destroy each creature and artifact.

Mugwump.card_text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Mugwump, fully heal Mugwump and give it a +1 power counter.

Hypnotic Command.card_text: Play: For each friendly Mars creature, choose an enemy creature to capture 1<A> from their own side.

Restringuntus.card_text: Play: Choose a house. Your opponent cannot choose that house as their active house until Restringuntus leaves play.

Oath of Poverty.card_text: Play: Destroy each of your artifacts. Gain 2<A> for each artifact destroyed this way.

Kelifi Dragon.card_text: Kelifi Dragon cannot be played unless you have 7<A> or more.Fight/Reap: Gain 1<A>. Deal 5<D> to a creature.

Harland Mindlock.card_text: Play: Take control of an enemy flank creature until Harland Mindlock leaves play.

Witch of the Wilds.card_text: During each turn in which Untamed is not your active house, you may play one Untamed card.

One Stood Against Many.card_text: Play: Ready and fight with a friendly creature 3 times, each time against a different enemy creature. Resolve these fights one at a time.

Reverse Time.card_text: Play: Swap your deck and your discard pile. Then, shuffle your deck.

Hebe the Huge.card_text: Play: Deal 2<D> to each other undamaged creature.

Creeping Oblivion.card_text: Play: Purge up to 2 cards from a discard pile.
Creeping Oblivion.flavor_text: “As far as oblivions go, it’s in my bottom three.” –Dr. Escotera

Piranha Monkeys.card_text: Play/Reap: Deal 2<D> to each other creature.
Piranha Monkeys.flavor_text: They can skeletonize a snufflegator in two minutes flat.

Take that, Smartypants.card_text: Play: Steal 2<A> if your opponent has 3 or more Logos cards in play.
Take that, Smartypants.flavor_text: “Them bots don’t wear pants. I carry spares.”

Imperial Traitor.card_text: Play: Look at your opponent’s hand. You may choose and purge a Sanctum card in it.

Chuff Ape.card_text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Chuff Ape enters play stunned.Fight/Reap: You may sacrifice another friendly creature. If you do, fully heal Chuff Ape.

Yo Mama Mastery.card_text: This creature gains taunt.Play: Fully heal this creature.

Sanctum Guardian.card_text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Fight/Reap: Swap Sanctum Guardian with another friendly creature in your battleline.

Iron Obelisk.card_text: Your opponent’s keys cost +1<A> for each friendly damaged Brobnar creature.

Sniffer.card_text: Action: For the remainder of the turn, each creature loses elusive.
Sniffer.flavor_text: Even the Martians’ pets have a bone to pick with the other lifeforms on the Crucible.

Duma the Martyr.card_text: Destroyed: Fully heal each other friendly creature and draw 2 cards.
Duma the Martyr.flavor_text: “Remember me.”  - Squire Duma, at the Battle for the Gate of Hope.

Custom Virus.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Custom Virus. Purge a creature from your hand. Destroy each creature that shares a trait with the purged creature.

Ozmo, Martianologist.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Fight/Reap: Heal 3 damage from a Mars creature or stun a Mars creature.

Looter Goblin.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1<A> each time an enemy creature is destroyed.

The Common Cold.card_text: Play: Deal 1<D> to each creature. You may destroy all Mars creatures.
The Common Cold.flavor_text: “As it turns out, it’s a weaker version of the uncommon cold.” –Dr. Escotera

Word of Returning.card_text: Play: Deal 1<D> to each enemy creature for each <A> on it. Return all <A> from those creatures to your pool.

Brothers in Battle.card_text: Play: Choose a house. For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature of that house may fight.

Guilty Hearts.card_text: Play: Destroy each creature with any <A> on it.
Guilty Hearts.flavor_text: C’mon, take it. You know you want to.

Replicator.card_text: Reap: Trigger the reap effect of another creature in play as if you controlled that creature. (That creature does not exhaust.)

Stampede.card_text: Play: If you used 3 or more creatures this turn, steal 2<A>.
Stampede.flavor_text: “Better to run with the herd than be trampled beneath it.” –Eldest Bear

Annihilation Ritual.card_text: When a creature would enter a discard pile from play, it is purged instead.

Feeding Pit.card_text: Action: Discard a creature from your hand. If you do, gain 1<A>.

Rogue Ogre.card_text: At the end of your turn, if you played exactly one card this turn, Rogue Ogre heals 2 damage and captures 1<A>.
Rogue Ogre.flavor_text: “I like to think of it as a Roguere.” –Dodger

Hayyel the Merchant.card_text: Each time you play an artifact, gain 1<A>.
Hayyel the Merchant.flavor_text: “The Enlightened are above haggling. Me, on the other hand…”

Begone!.card_text: Play: Choose one: destroy each Dis creature, or gain 1<A>.

Bear Flute.card_text: Action: Fully heal an Ancient Bear. If there are no Ancient Bears in play, search your deck and discard pile and put each Ancient Bear from them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your discard pile into your deck.

Swap Widget.card_text: Action: Return a ready friendly Mars creature to your hand. If you do, put a Mars creature with a different name from your hand into play, then ready it.

Teliga.card_text: Each time your opponent plays a creature, gain 1<A>.
Teliga.flavor_text: “Don’t try to change the Crucible to suit your needs. Let it change you.”

Master of 2.card_text: Reap: You may destroy a creature with 2 power.

Martian Hounds.card_text: Play: Choose a creature. For each damaged creature, give the chosen creature two +1 power counters.
